timeline.message: Added ucum service existing test cases passed

Merge branch 'master' into ft-ucum-support

Added length for the string type

timeline.bodyText:
I think calling this feature "ucum support" is perhaps a bit too vague, since there are other ways you can use UCUM (e.g. for validation) even with this featured turned off.
How about getNormalizedQuantitySearch...?
timeline.author: jamesagnew
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -585,4 +588,44 @@ private static void validateTreatBaseUrlsAsLocal(String theUrl) { } } + + /** + * Set the UCUM service support level + * + *

+ * The default value is {@link UcumSupportLevelEnum#UCUM_NOT_SUPPORTED} which is current behavior. + *

+ *

+ * Here is the UCUM service support level + *

    + *
  • {@link UcumSupportLevelEnum#UCUM_NOT_SUPPORTED}, default, Quantity is stored in {@link ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantity} only and it is used by searching.
    • + *
  • {@link UcumSupportLevelEnum#UCUM_STORAGE_SUPPORTED}, Quantity is stored in both {@link ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantity} and {@link ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantityNormalized}, but {@link ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantity} is used by searching.
    • + *
  • {@link UcumSupportLevelEnum#UCUM_SEARCH_SUPPORTED}, Quantity is stored in both {@link ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantity} and {@link ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantityNormalized}, {@link ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantityNormalized} is used by searching.
    • + *
  • {@link UcumSupportLevelEnum#UCUM_FULL_SUPPORTED}, Quantity is stored in only in {@link ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantityNormalized}, {@link ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantityNormalized} is used by searching. NOTE： this option is not supported yet.
    • + *
+ *

+ * + * @since 5.3.0 + */ + public UcumSupportLevelEnum getUcumSupportLevel() {

replies.bodyText: I have added a new field SP_QUANTITY_NRML_PRESENT to the ResourceTable, after deploying the war to my local server (tomcat+postgresql), the field is set to NULL instead false for the existing column, is this normal? @jamesagnew
replies.author: frankjtao

replies.bodyText: @frankjtao yup, it'll default to null. You should set your code up to treat null as if it was false so that it doesn't cause any issues for people who are migrating.
replies.author: jamesagnew

timeline.author: jamesagnew

timeline.bodyText:
It's possible I just missed these, but there are a couple of cases I don't see tests for that I think would be good to add:


Ucum Search Enabled, but search using a quantity that has an invalid UCUM code, e.g. "system":"http://unitsofmeasure.org", "code": "FOO", "value": 100 (I think we should make sure this can be performed, just in case the UCUM library is missing a real unit)


Ucum Search Enabled, but search using a quantity that isn't UCUM, e.g. "system":"http://bar", "code": "FOO", "value": 100


Ucum Search Enabled, then use an OR expression combining UCUM and non-UCUM query, e.g. `Observation?value-quantity=100|http://unitsofmeasure|cm,100|foo|cm
timeline.author: jamesagnew

replies.bodyText: Add test cases to cover the above scenario
replies.author: frankjtao

It's possible I just missed these, but there are a couple of cases I don't see tests for that I think would be good to add:

Ucum Storage supported - Make sure we create rows in both the standard and normalized quantity index tables
Ucum Search supported - Make sure we create rows in both the standard and normalized quantity index tables

timeline.bodyText: Not related to this line, but adding a comment here: Could you also add tests to InMemorySubscriptionMatcherR4Test with normalized search mode enabled, just to make sure that enabling this new mode doesn't break the in-memory search mode (this feature is used for subscription processing)
timeline.author: jamesagnew

replies.bodyText: Good catch, I have found a bug in the inmemory search. It's fixed and added more test cases in InMemorySubscriptionMatcherR4Test  @jamesagnew

timeline.message: Updated the migration task based on review comments
Fixed RES_TYPE with type String and length 100

timeline.bodyText:
Just discovered a problem with this field that occurs during DB migration. It appears that during startup when a new column is added to an existing table that has rows in it, it will also attempt to populate the column with null values. However primitive types cannot be null and so this causes errors.
I think the safest option to fix this problem is to type this column as a java Boolean class rather than as a boolean primitive.
timeline.author: IanMMarshall
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -149,6 +146,22 @@
 	@Column(name = "SP_QUANTITY_PRESENT")
 	@OptimisticLock(excluded = true)
 	private boolean myParamsQuantityPopulated;
+	
+	/**
+	 * Added to support UCUM conversion
+	 * since 5.3.0
+	 */
+	@OneToMany(mappedBy = "myResource", cascade = {}, fetch = FetchType.LAZY, orphanRemoval = false)
+	@OptimisticLock(excluded = true)
+	private Collection<ResourceIndexedSearchParamQuantityNormalized> myParamsQuantityNormalized;
+	
+	/**
+	 * Added to support UCUM conversion
+	 * since 5.3.0
+	 */
+	@Column(name = "SP_QUANTITY_NRML_PRESENT")
+	@OptimisticLock(excluded = true)
+	private boolean myParamsQuantityNormalizedPopulated;
